scarcely.definition::
[adv.] 刚；几乎不；勉强；简直不
[网络] 仅仅；几乎没有；刚刚
scarcely.example::
[1] Here was the long, listless penis, there the curt, athletic knob or innocent rosebud of someone scarcely out of school.
[2] I scarcely need say how much I enjoyed the holiday.
[3] My heart was beating so fast, and there was such a singing in my ears, that I could scarcely stammer I had no objection .

strange.definition::
[adj.] 奇怪的；奇特的；异常的；陌生的
[网络] 奇异的；诡异
strange.example::
[1] Astronomers had been trying to explain the strange orbit of the seventh planet, Uranus .
[2] It's strange to think, but we've been together since March and yet this was really the first time we got to talk a lot.
[3] I continue to walk along the walls of this dilapidated, to go about her way, but a strange cul -de-sac beside copied.

equator.definition::
[n.] 赤道
[网络] 天球赤道；地球赤道；中纬线
equator.example::
[1] Since the Earth's rotational axis is tilted, the Sun is directly over the equator just twice a year.
[2] Collectivist societies tend to pop up in parts of the world, especially around the equator, with plenty of disease-causing microbes.
[3] And, given that the Equator is only a few hundred kilometres away, there is only the briefest of dawns between deep night and bright day.

devil.definition::
[n.] 魔鬼；恶魔；魔王；撒旦
[v.] 〈美口〉虐待；用辣子烤(肉等)；(用切碎机)切碎
[网络] 电梯里的恶魔；恶棍；鬼子
devil.example::
[1] His victims have called him a "monster" and a "devil" and want him jailed for the rest of his life.
[2] He desired for land because he was a farmer. He was still a little afraid of the devil because he did not have enough land then.
[3] When the devil came, he found nothing but the stubble, and went away in a fury down into a cleft in the rocks.

faint.definition::
[n.] 昏厥
[v.] 昏厥
[adj.] 昏眩；（光、声、味）微弱的；微小的；可能性不大的
[网络] 昏倒；晕倒；模糊的
faint.example::
[1] As he spoke of this a light came into his eyes, and a faint smile appeared on his lips.
[2] When he saw the emperor, he stared at him intently and then said in a faint whisper, "Please forgive me. "
[3] Mr Medvedev may never have been a real alternative to Mr Putin, but he held out the faint possibility of a transition of power.
